text: Hellmuth Karasek (4 January 1934 - 29 September 2015) was a German journalist, literary critic and novelist. He wrote over 25 books on literature and movies. He was well known for being on the panel of the show Das Literarische Quartett, with Marcel Reich-Ranicki. In 1968, he became the theatre critic of Die Zeit. From 1974 until 1996, he worked for Der Spiegel. In 1999, he was a member of the jury at the 49th Berlin International Film Festival. Karasek was born in Br端nn, Czechoslovakia (now Brno, Czech Republic). He moved from Bielitz (now Poland) to Bernburg in 1944 during World War II. In the 1950s, he became a student at the University of T端bingen in T端bingen, Baden-W端rttemberg (then West Germany). Karasek died on 29 September 2015 in Hamburg. He was 81. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1934 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Disease-related deaths in Germany Category:German critics Category:German journalists Category:German novelists Category:Literary critics Category:People from Brno
title: Hellmuth Karasek
